channel.title: New York Hockey Talk... with Rob Kowal
channel.description: Show features interviews with bloggers from the New York area NHL hockey teams, in addition to past, present, and future players, broadcasters, and front office personnel.

image.title: New York Hockey Talk... with Rob Kowal

channel.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
channel.itunes:summary: Shows feature interviews with past, present, and future players, broadcasters, and front office personnel from all of the local New York hockey teams. In addition, many hard core fans from the online hockey communities, such as bloggers and fan website administrators, will be on the show from time to time to give their insights on the New York area teams. Broadcast LIVE from Long Island's 1240AM-WGBB on Sunday nights from 9:00pm to 10:00pm, the show can also be heard live on the internet by going to http://www.nyhockeytalk.com. All past broadcasts of the show are also available for download from the website.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Hockey discussions regarding the Rangers, Islanders, and Devils.

item.title: 10/23/2011 - Jiggs McDonald; Kerry Fraser
item.description: Hosted by Rob Kowal and Brad Kurtzberg. Guests on the program included longtime Islanders broadcaster Jiggs McDonald, who spoke about the Islanders play to start the season. Next on the show was frequent guest Matt Sweetwood from the popular Devils fan website and message forum NJDEVS. Matt as always gave his pointed insights on the New Jersey Devils. Finally the guys closed out the show talking with the recently retired NHL referee turned NHL analyst Kerry Fraser. Kerry spoke about some of the more memorable incidents throughout his 30 year career, many of which are featured in his new book entitled The Final Call: Hockey Stories from a Legend in Stripes coming out in November.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: Hosted by Rob Kowal and Brad Kurtzberg. Guests on the program included longtime Islanders broadcaster Jiggs McDonald, who spoke about the Islanders play to start the season. Kerry spoke about some of the more memorable incidents throughout his 30 year career, many of which are featured in his new book entitled The Final Call: Hockey Stories from a Legend in Stripes coming out in November.

item.title: 04/10/2011 - Justin Bourne, Matt Sweetwood, Dave Lozo
item.description: Hosted by Brad Kurtzberg and Dee Karl. Guests included Justin Bourne, author of the popular Bourne’s Blog followed by Matt Sweetwood of njdevs.com and finally Dave Lozo of nhl.com.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: Hosted by Brad Kurtzberg and Dee Karl. Guests included Justin Bourne, author of the popular Bourne’s Blog followed by Matt Sweetwood of njdevs.com and finally Dave Lozo of nhl.com.

item.title: 03/27/2011 - Brad Kurtzberg, Dee Karl, Margaret Hurley
item.description: Brad Kurtzberg from Inside Hockey and Dee Karl from Hockey Buzz sit in to host for Rob Kowal. Guests included Matt Sweetwood of NJ Devs and Margaret Hurley of My Blueshirt Heaven.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: Brad Kurtzberg from Inside Hockey and Dee Karl from Hockey Buzz sit in to host for Rob Kowal. Guests included Matt Sweetwood of NJ Devs and Margaret Hurley of My Blueshirt Heaven.

item.title: 02/27/2011 - Fighting in the NHL; Paul Stewart, Steve Carlson
item.description: Hosted by Rob Kowal along with Brad Kurtzberg. Fighting in the NHL was the focus of the show. Guests included Steve Carlson (aka Steve Hanson) from the 1977 cult classic hockey film Slap Shot followed by former NHL referee Paul Stewart.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: Hosted by Rob Kowal along with Brad Kurtzberg. Fighting in the NHL was the focus of the show. Guests included Steve Carlson (aka Steve Hanson) from the 1977 cult classic hockey film Slap Shot followed by former NHL referee Paul Stewart.

item.title: 01/30/2011 - Jeff Beukeboom, Randy Gorman
item.description: Hosted by Rob Kowal, along with Brad Kurtzburg. The guys kicked things off with some 1st half analysis of the local teams, followed by former Rangers defenseman Jeff Beukeboom, and later some NHL All-Star game talk. The last portion of the program featured NHL draft expert Randy Gorman of McKeen's Hockey Scouting in Vancouver, Canada who talked with the guys about the top prospects for each of the three New York area teams, as well as some of the top players available for this year's draft.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: Hosted by Rob Kowal, along with Brad Kurtzburg. The guys kicked things off with some 1st half analysis of the local teams, followed by former Rangers defenseman Jeff Beukeboom, and later some NHL All-Star game talk. The last portion of the program featured NHL draft expert Randy Gorman of McKeen's Hockey Scouting in Vancouver, Canada who talked with the guys about the top prospects for each of the three New York area teams, as well as some of the top players available for this year's draft.

item.title: 01/02/2011 - Chris King, Matt Sweetwood, Margaret Hurley
item.description: Hosted by Brad Kurtzberg, sitting in for Rob Kowal. Guests included Matt Sweetwood from the popular Devils message forum website NJDevs.com, followed by New York Islanders radio broadcaster Chris King and finally Margaret Hurley from the popular New York Rangers blog My Blueshirt Heaven.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal

Guests included Matt Sweetwood from the popular Devils message forum website NJDevs.com, followed by New York Islanders radio broadcaster Chris King and finally Margaret Hurley from the popular New York Rangers blog My Blueshirt Heaven.

item.title: 08/29/2010 - Justin Bourne, Andrew MacDonald, Matt Sweetwood
item.description: Hosted by Brad Kurtzberg, sitting in for Rob Kowal. Guests on the show included Matt Sweetwood from njdevs.com, Justin Bourne from Bourne's Blog, current Islanders defenseman Andrew MacDonald and finally Rangers broadcaster Dave Maloney.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: Hosted by Brad Kurtzberg, sitting in for Rob Kowal. Guests on the show included Matt Sweetwood from njdevs.com, Justin Bourne from Bourne's Blog, current Islanders defenseman Andrew MacDonald and finally Rangers broadcaster Dave Maloney.

item.title: 04/04/2010 - Justin Bourne, Matt Sweetwood, Kevin Greenstein
item.description: Brad Kurtzberg sits in to host for Rob Kowal. Guests on the show included Kevin Greenstein from Inside Hockey, followed by show regular Matt Sweetwood from NJDEVS.COM. Last on the show was hockey player turned writer, Justin Bourne- author of the popular BOURNE'S BLOG. Justin is also the son of former Islander great Bob Bourne.

item.title: 03/07/2010 - Brendan Shanahan, Al Arbour
item.description: Rob Kowal hosts. Guests on the program included former NY Rangers and NJ Devils forward BRENDAN SHANAHAN, and former Islanders head coach AL ARBOUR. Islanders talk with insidehockey.com's BRAD KURTZBERG closed out the show.

item.title: 01/24/2010 - Brad Kurtzberg hosts
item.description: Brad Kurtzberg sits in to host for Rob Kowal. The jam packed show included guests Kevin Greenstein from Inside Hockey, followed by author Jay Moran, then Chris Wassel of The Program, Matt Sweetwood of NJDEVS.COM and finally Peter Botte of the Daily News.

item.title: 01/03/2010 - Dave Maloney, Bob Bourne, Peter McNab
item.description: Rob Kowal hosts. Guests on the show included Rangers analyst DAVE MALONEY, who talked about the Rangers recent struggles to score and to win at home- followed by former New York Islanders forward BOB BOURNE, who spoke about his 14-year career. Rob closed the show out talking with former New Jersey Devils player and broadcaster PETER MCNAB.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: Rob Kowal hosts. Rob closed the show out talking with former New Jersey Devils player and broadcaster PETER MCNAB.

item.title: 12/06/2009 - Mike Gartner, Paul Stewart
item.description: Rob Kowal hosts. The Connecticut Post's MICHAEL FORNABAIO lets us know how Isles goalie Rick DiPietro did in his first game back in Bridgeport. Then former New York Ranger MIKE GARTNER talks with Rob about his hockey career, followed by longtime retired NHL referee PAUL STEWART, who shared some stories from his long career.

item.title: 11/01/2009 - Derek King, Kris King, Chico Resch
item.description: Rob Kowal hosts, along with special guest co-host Matt Sweetwood from the popular site NJDEVS.COM. Guests on the program included former New York Islanders forward Derek King as well as former New York Rangers forward Kris King. Then, New Jersey Devils TV color analyst Chico Resch closed out the show.

item.title: 10/18/2009 - Stan Fischler, Mark Herrmann
item.description: Brad Kurtzberg hosts this special edition of the show. Guests on the program included the hockey maven Stan Fischler, followed Newsday columnist Mark Herrmann, and then Kevin Greenstein of Inside Hockey.

item.title: 09/27/2009 - Mikko Makela, Chris Kotsopoulos
item.description: Rob Kowal hosts. Guests on the show included Dee Karl from hockeybuzz.com, who spoke about the Islanders and the Lighthouse Project, followed by former Islanders forward Mikko Makela. Then former New York Rangers defenseman Chris Kotsopoulos, who now authors the very popular blog Kotsy's Korner, came on the program to talk some Rangers hockey.

item.title: 05/03/2009 - Dave Maloney, Dee Karl, njdevs.com
item.description: Brad Kurtzberg sat in to guest host for Rob, and was first joined by Kevin Greenstein of insidehockey.com, followed by NY Rangers analyst Dave Maloney. Then njdevs.com's Matt Sweetwood came on the show to talk some Devils hockey with Brad. To close out the program, Dee Karl, author of The 7th Woman blog, joined Brad in the studio to talk about the New York Islanders season, and discussed teams upcoming #1 draft pick possibilities.

item.title: 04/05/2009 - Greg Logan, Pete Stemkowski
item.description: Host Rob Kowal is joined on the show by insidehockey.com's Brad Kurtzberg, who co-hosted with Rob. Newsday's GREG LOGAN was be on the program and spoke about the Islanders, in addition to radio personality JOSH BREWSTER from hockeytalk.biz, and former Rangers forward PETE STEMKOWSKI.

item.title: 03/01/2009 - Andy Bathgate, Jiggs McDonald
item.description: Host Rob Kowal talked with BRAD KURTZBERG from insidehockey.com about the latest in New York hockey, followed by longtime Islanders broadcaster JIGGS MCDONALD. After the break Rob aired Part II of his interview with former Rangers forward ANDY BATHGATE, and afterwards chatted with longtime Rangers fan and friend of the show JOSEPH DUROCHER. The new voice of Sports Radio New York, GREG BOYES also made a brief appearance at the end of the program.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal

The new voice of Sports Radio New York, GREG BOYES also made a brief appearance at the end of the program.

item.title: 02/01/2009 - Harry Howell, Andy Bathgate
item.description: With the New York Rangers retiring the numbers HARRY HOWELL (#3) and ANDY BATHGATE (#9) on February 22nd at Madison Square Garden- the show revolved around these two great former Rangers. Both Harry Howell and Andy Bathgate were guests on the show, and talked about their hall-of-fame careers.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal

Both Harry Howell and Andy Bathgate were guests on the show, and talked about their hall-of-fame careers.

item.title: 01/04/2009 - Mark Herrmann, Margaret Hurley
item.description: Brad Kurtzberg guest hosted the show, starting things off with KEVIN GREENSTEIN from insidehockey.com, followed by Newsday columnist MARK HERRMANN. Then Brad talked a little Devils hockey with MATT SWEETWOOD from njdevs.com, followed by some NY Rangers discussion with blogger MARGARET HURLEY, author of the blog My Blueshirt Heaven.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal

item.title: 12/07/2008 - Chico Resch, Bobby Sanguinetti
item.description: Guests on the show included BRAD KURTZBERG from insidehockey.com, who brought us update us on the Islanders, Rangers, and Devils. New Jersey Devils color commentator CHICO RESCH then spoke to Rob about Devils recent play. Rangers prospect and Hartford WolfPack defenseman BOBBY SANGUINETTI then talked with Rob about being a part of the Rangers organization, and his transition to the pro game this season. BRIAN MONZO from snyrangersblog.com closed out the show talking with Rob mostly about the Rangers power play woes this season.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal

New Jersey Devils color commentator CHICO RESCH then spoke to Rob about Devils recent play. Rangers prospect and Hartford WolfPack defenseman BOBBY SANGUINETTI then talked with Rob about being a part of the Rangers organization, and his transition to the pro game this season. BRIAN MONZO from snyrangersblog.com closed out the show talking with Rob mostly about the Rangers power play woes this season.

item.title: 11/02/2008 - Doc Emrick, Kelly Kisio
item.description: Guests on the show included Brad Kurtzberg from insidehockey.com, who brought us update us on the Islanders, Rangers, and Devils. The voice of the New Jersey Devils MIKE 'DOC' EMRICK then spoke to Rob about his broadcasting career and the New Jersey Devils. Former Rangers forward and captain KELLY KISIO closed out the show talking with Rob about his career, his time in New York with the Rangers, and what he is doing today.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: Guests on the show included Brad Kurtzberg from insidehockey.com, who brought us update us on the Islanders, Rangers, and Devils. The voice of the New Jersey Devils MIKE 'DOC' EMRICK then spoke to Rob about his broadcasting career and the New Jersey Devils. Former Rangers forward and captain KELLY KISIO closed out the show talking with Rob about his career, his time in New York with the Rangers, and what he is doing today.

item.title: 10/05/2008 - Season Debut; Dave Maloney,Jiggs McDonald
item.description: Guests on the season debut of the show included James Murphy, from the popular hockey website insidehockey.com, followed by former New York Ranger and current radio announcer Dave Maloney. Then njdevs.com site administrator and frequent guest Matt Sweetwood talked some Devils hockey with Rob, followed by former Islanders television play-by-play announcer Jiggs McDonald. Finally, Bridgeport Soundtigers PA announcer and Zambonis lead singer Dave Schneider closed out the show.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal

item.title: 03/02/2008 - Brad Kurtzberg Guest Host
item.description: Inside Hockey's Brad Kurtzberg sat in for Rob in once again this week to host the show. Islanders 'Blog Boxer' Tom Liodice led things off in the studio to talk some Islanders hockey, followed by Mark Hermann from Newsday. After the break Rangers fan and blogger Margaret Hurley, from My Blueshirt Heaven, always a NY Hockey Talk favorite, closed out the show.

item.title: 02/17/2008 - Brad Kurtzberg Guest Host
item.description: Inside Hockey's Brad Kurtzberg sat in and hosted the show for Rob this week, and didn't miss a beat speaking first with Matt Sweetwood from NJDEVS.COM, followed by blogger Stephen Lindsay, aka The Dark Ranger. After the break Brad talked with the host of On The Warpath, Ryan Abshagen from Sabres Insider. Brad then wrapped things up re-airing a previous interview Rob had with former New York Islanders forward Steve Webb.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: Inside Hockey's Brad Kurtzberg sat in and hosted the show for Rob this week, and didn't miss a beat speaking first with Matt Sweetwood from NJDEVS.COM, followed by blogger Stephen Lindsay, aka The Dark Ranger. After the break Brad talked with the host of On The Warpath, Ryan Abshagen from Sabres Insider. Brad then wrapped things up re-airing a previous interview Rob had with former New York Islanders forward Steve Webb.

item.title: 01/27/2008 - Jiggs McDonald, Barry Beck, WGR550
item.description: This week hockey writer Patrick Hoffman joined Rob to talk about the retirement of Brian Leetch's #2 this past Thursday night at the Garden, and the play of the Rangers so far this season. Brian Koziol from WGR-550 sports radio in Buffalo spoke to Rob about the recent play of the Sabres. Longtime Islanders broadcaster and hockey Hall-of-Famer Jiggs McDonald then spoke to Rob about his broadcasting career, and the current Islanders team. Finally, former New York Ranger Barry Beck surprised the show with a call from Hong Kong, China to talk about some of what he is up to today.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: This week hockey writer Patrick Hoffman joined Rob to talk about the retirement of Brian Leetch's #2 this past Thursday night at the Garden, and the play of the Rangers so far this season. Brian Koziol from WGR-550 sports radio in Buffalo spoke to Rob about the recent play of the Sabres. Longtime Islanders broadcaster and hockey Hall-of-Famer Jiggs McDonald then spoke to Rob about his broadcasting career, and the current Islanders team. Finally, former New York Ranger Barry Beck surprised the show with a call from Hong Kong, China to talk about some of what he is up to today.

item.title: 01/13/2008 - John Dellapina, Bloggers
item.description: Rob returned to the airwaves after a 2 week absense, and had alot to talk about with all that has gone on with the New York teams so far this year. Tonight's show kicked off with some Rangers talk with John Dellapina from the NY Daily News, followed by Kevin Pritchard from the popular Buffalo sports fan blog site BfloBlog. Also on the show was John Fischer from the popular Devils fan blog site, In Lou We Trust. Finally, co-host of the NY Hockey Report and author of the blog A View From Section 317's Gary Harding joined Rob live in the studio to talk some Islanders hockey.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal

Also on the show was John Fischer from the popular Devils fan blog site, In Lou We Trust. Finally, co-host of the NY Hockey Report and author of the blog A View From Section 317's Gary Harding joined Rob live in the studio to talk some Islanders hockey.

item.title: 12/30/2007 - End of '08 Highlights Show
item.description: End of Year Highlights Show. This week's show, the last one of 2007, Rob takes a look back at the first 13 shows, and airs various highlights from some of his favorite interviews during the past 14 weeks.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: End of Year Highlights Show. This week's show, the last one of 2007, Rob takes a look back at the first 13 shows, and airs various highlights from some of his favorite interviews during the past 14 weeks.

item.title: 12/23/2007 - Steve Webb, James Mirtle, Bloggers, WGR550
item.description: This week Rangers fan and blogger Margaret Hurley, from My Blueshirt Heaven, joined Rob live on the air from Madison Square Garden's section 409, and gave a report on the Rangers-Senators game that was going on during the show. How does a Devils fan end up living in Calgary? Rob found out when Calgary native and Devils fan Peter Hadweh spoke with Rob live from the Devils-Flames game at the Saddledome in Calgary. Hockey writer James Mirtle also came on the show to discuss his blog, some of his recent posts, and the New York teams. Former New York Islander Steve Webb was also on the show to talk about his Islanders career, and how the team is doing today. Finally, NY Hockey Talk regular Jeremy Noeson from WGG-550 in Bufffalo closed out the show talking some Sabres hockey.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: This week Rangers fan and blogger Margaret Hurley, from My Blueshirt Heaven, joined Rob live on the air from Madison Square Garden's section 409, and gave a report on the Rangers-Senators game that was going on during the show. How does a Devils fan end up living in Calgary? Rob found out when Calgary native and Devils fan Peter Hadweh spoke with Rob live from the Devils-Flames game at the Saddledome in Calgary. Hockey writer James Mirtle also came on the show to discuss his blog, some of his recent posts, and the New York teams. Former New York Islander Steve Webb was also on the show to talk about his Islanders career, and how the team is doing today. Finally, NY Hockey Talk regular Jeremy Noeson from WGG-550 in Bufffalo closed out the show talking some Sabres hockey.

item.title: 12/16/2007 - Jan Erixon, Bloggers, The Zambonis
item.description: Guests on this weeks show included former New York Ranger Jan Erixon, who spoke with Rob about his career, and what he is doing today. Sabres fan David Oleksy was on the show and talked about the recent play of the Sabres and his Die By The Blade blog. Fellow blogger and Devils fan Josh Burnett from 2 Man Advantage finally made it on the show to talk some Devils hockey... and finally Dave Schneider, lead singer for the hockey rock band The Zambonis, ended the show talking to Rob about the band, and of course some hockey- specifically the play of the New York Islanders and the Bridgeport Soundtigers, where he is also an employee of the team.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal

Sabres fan David Oleksy was on the show and talked about the recent play of the Sabres and his Die By The Blade blog. Fellow blogger and Devils fan Josh Burnett from 2 Man Advantage finally made it on the show to talk some Devils hockey... and finally Dave Schneider, lead singer for the hockey rock band The Zambonis, ended the show talking to Rob about the band, and of course some hockey- specifically the play of the New York Islanders and the Bridgeport Soundtigers, where he is also an employee of the team.

item.title: 12/09/2007 - Eddie Mio, Kuklas Korner, Dubi Silverstein
item.description: Paul Kukla from the popular Kuklas Korner website started off the show with Rob, talking about his site, and giving his thoughts on all of the New York teams. The Newark Star Ledger's Rich Chere was on the program and spoke with Rob about the recent play of the New Jersey Devils. Also on the show was Dubi Silverstein from the well known Rangers fan website Blueshirt Bulletin. Former Rangers goaltender Eddie Mio was Rob's last guest of the evening, and talked about his career in New York with the Rangers, and what he is up to today.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: Paul Kukla from the popular Kuklas Korner website started off the show with Rob, talking about his site, and giving his thoughts on all of the New York teams. The Newark Star Ledger's Rich Chere was on the program and spoke with Rob about the recent play of the New Jersey Devils. Also on the show was Dubi Silverstein from the well known Rangers fan website Blueshirt Bulletin. Former Rangers goaltender Eddie Mio was Rob's last guest of the evening, and talked about his career in New York with the Rangers, and what he is up to today.

item.title: 12/02/2007 - Doug Bodger, Ranger Prospects, Brad Kurtzberg
item.description: This week Hartford Wolfpack radio play-by-play announcer Bob Crawford joined Rob to talk about the recent play of the Rangers AHL affiliate, and some of their top prospects. Former Sabres defenseman Doug Bodger was also be on the show to talk about his career, particularly his time in Buffalo. Finally, the show closed out with author Brad Kurtzberg live in the studio, who spoke to Rob about his book, Shorthanded: The Untold Story of the Seals, Hockey's Most Colorful Team. Discussion included some of the ex-Seals players also played on the New York area teams. Brad also reports on the Islanders for insidehockey.com.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: This week Hartford Wolfpack radio play-by-play announcer Bob Crawford joined Rob to talk about the recent play of the Rangers AHL affiliate, and some of their top prospects. Former Sabres defenseman Doug Bodger was also be on the show to talk about his career, particularly his time in Buffalo. Discussion included some of the ex-Seals players also played on the New York area teams. Brad also reports on the Islanders for insidehockey.com.

item.title: 11/25/2007 - Bryan Berard, Greg Logan, Valerie Kamensky
item.description: This week, Rob spoke with current Islanders defenseman Bryan Berard, in addition to Newsday's Greg Logan, who talked about the play of the Islanders this season. Former Ranger (and Devil) Valeri Kamensky was also on the program, as he talked about his time playing in New York, and the current team of Russian hockey stars he is now playing with- a team that will be taking on the N.Y.P.D. at Chelsea Piers Thursday afternoon, November 29th, at 4:30pm. The second half of the show featured Matt Sweetwood from the popular Devils fan forum NJDEVS, followed by Rangers fan Jonathan Ragus from NYR Nation.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: This week, Rob spoke with current Islanders defenseman Bryan Berard, in addition to Newsday's Greg Logan, who talked about the play of the Islanders this season. Former Ranger (and Devil) Valeri Kamensky was also on the program, as he talked about his time playing in New York, and the current team of Russian hockey stars he is now playing with- a team that will be taking on the N.Y.P.D. at Chelsea Piers Thursday afternoon, November 29th, at 4:30pm. The second half of the show featured Matt Sweetwood from the popular Devils fan forum NJDEVS, followed by Rangers fan Jonathan Ragus from NYR Nation.

item.title: 11/18/2007 - Bryan Trottier, BfloBlog.com
item.description: After taking last Sunday evening off, Rob made his return to the airwaves. Guests on the show included Kevin Pritchard from the popular BfloBlog.com, to talk some Sabres hockey with Rob. Former New York Ranger Pierre Larouche spoke to Rob about his career, his time in New York, what he is doing today, and a little about today's Rangers. Finally former New York Islander Bryan Trottier was on the show, as he talked a little about Coach Al Arbour, as well as giving some of his thoughts on the current Islanders team.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal
item.itunes:summary: After taking last Sunday evening off, Rob made his return to the airwaves. Guests on the show included Kevin Pritchard from the popular BfloBlog.com, to talk some Sabres hockey with Rob. Finally former New York Islander Bryan Trottier was on the show, as he talked a little about Coach Al Arbour, as well as giving some of his thoughts on the current Islanders team.

item.title: 11/04/2007 - Stan Fischler, Brad Dalgarno, Al Arbour Talk
item.description: Stan Fischler was on the show to talk about the early play of the New York teams, and to discuss some of his thoughts and memories of coach Al Arbour, who coached his 1,500th game the previous day. Former NY Islander Brad Dalgarno was on the show and spoke to Rob his hockey career, gave his thoughts on coach Arbour, and talked about what he is doing today. Rob's interview with former Islander Pierre Turgeon, originally aired October 7th, was also re-run on the show.

Former NY Islander Brad Dalgarno was on the show and spoke to Rob his hockey career, gave his thoughts on coach Arbour, and talked about what he is doing today. Rob's interview with former Islander Pierre Turgeon, originally aired October 7th, was also re-run on the show.

item.title: 10/28/2007 - IslandersTV, Carey Wilson, Arron Asham, WGR550
item.description: New York Islanders Vice President of Communications Josh Bernstein was on the program, and talked about the innovation of Islanders TV. Current New Jersey Devil and former New York Islander Arron Asham was also on the show, in addition to Jeremy Noeson of WGR-550 Sports Radio in Buffalo, who talked some Sabres hockey with Rob. Finally, retired NHL center-man and former NY Ranger Carey Wilson was on the show live from Winnipeg, Manitoba and talked about his career, his time with the New York Rangers, and his hockey school.

item.title: 10/21/2007 - Rick Jenneret, Rangers Pundit, njdevs.com
item.description: This Sunday, longtime Buffalo Sabres television play-by-play announcer Rick Jeanneret will be a guest on the show. New Jersey Devils fan and administrator of the popular Devils message board njdevs.com, Matt Sweetwood will also be on the program. Joining Rob LIVE in the studio this week, will be New York Rangers fan and blogger Mike Savino, otherwise known as The Ranger Pundit !

item.title: 10/14/2007 - Ken Gernander, Randy Cunneyworth, Bloggers
item.description: This show kicked off with Rob's conversation with Hartford Wolfpack head coach Ken Gernander, followed by his LIVE discussion with Rochester Americans head coach Randy Cunneyworth. Then, blogger John Fischer followed to talk about his blog, In Lou We Trust, and about the latest concerning the New Jersey Devils. Finally, the show wrapped up with New York Islanders fan Dee Karl, who was LIVE in the studio, to talk about the Islanders and her blog, The 7th Woman.

Then, blogger John Fischer followed to talk about his blog, In Lou We Trust, and about the latest concerning the New Jersey Devils. Finally, the show wrapped up with New York Islanders fan Dee Karl, who was LIVE in the studio, to talk about the Islanders and her blog, The 7th Woman.

item.title: 10/07/2007 - Pierre Turgeon, Prospects Report
item.description: This show featured an interview with the recently retired former Buffalo Sabre and New York Islander Pierre Turgeon, who talked with Rob about his 19-year NHL career. The show will then shifted it's attention to the AHL affiliated teams of the Islanders and Devils. Bridgeport Soundtigers head coach Jack Capuano spoke to Rob, followed by Lowell Devils head coach Kurt Kleinendorst. Rangers fan Margaret Hurley closed out the show as she joined Rob live in the studio to talk about the Rangers, and her popular blog, My Blueshirt Heaven.
item.itunes:author: Rob Kowal

The show will then shifted it's attention to the AHL affiliated teams of the Islanders and Devils. Bridgeport Soundtigers head coach Jack Capuano spoke to Rob, followed by Lowell Devils head coach Kurt Kleinendorst. Rangers fan Margaret Hurley closed out the show as she joined Rob live in the studio to talk about the Rangers, and her popular blog, My Blueshirt Heaven.

item.title: 09/30/2007 - Devils/Sabres Preview
item.description: This week's show featured a preview of the New Jersey Devils and the Buffalo Sabres. Rich Chere from the Newark Star Ledger kicked of the show talking about the Devils, followed by Patricia Greuter and Josh Burnett from the popular Devils blog site 2 MAN ADVANTAGE. Unfortunatley, troubles with the phone at WGBB prevented Josh from contributing, but he will be on a future broadcast of the show. In the second half of the show, Rob was joined by Scott Sarama, administrator of the popular Sabres fan webite SabreSpace.com, followed by Jeremy Noeson of WGR-550 Sports Radio in Buffalo.

item.title: 09/23/2007 - Debut Show, Rangers/Islanders Preview
item.description: The debut show will feature an analysis of both the New York Rangers and the New York Islanders. Currently John Dellapina from the NY Daily News will be on the show live to give his thoughts on the Rangers, in addition to Toby Ivey from the website Outside The Garden. Nick DiMattei, the administrator of the popular Islanders message board Islanders Country, will also be on the program, along with Greg Logan of Newsday.
